articles.author: Granth Vanaik
articles.description: Workers at hundreds of Starbucks (SBUX.O) stores have begun walking off their jobs during a key promotional event on Thursday, demanding improved staffing and schedules, the Workers United said on social media platform X.
articles.title: Starbucks employees at hundreds of US stores walkout on 'Red Cup' day

articles.author: Byron Kaye
articles.description: Australia's second-largest telco, Optus, had no crisis plan when a network-wide outage left nearly half the country without phone or internet for 12 hours, an executive told parliament on Friday, acknowledging the company's defences had failed.
articles.title: Australian telco Optus tells lawmakers it had no plan to address total outage

articles.author: Anna Tong
articles.description: OpenAI, whose generative AI products initially raised fears of widespread cheating on homework, is now exploring how it can get its popular ChatGPT chatbot into classrooms, according to a senior executive.
articles.title: Exclusive: OpenAI explores how to get ChatGPT into classrooms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: SpaceX postponed its second attempt to launch the company's Starship rocket system into space by a day to Saturday, Chief Executive Elon Musk said, citing a piece of flight control hardware that needed replacing.
articles.title: SpaceX delays Starship test flight a day over hardware swap

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. government went back to basics in arguments against Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) Google on Thursday, wrapping up the evidentiary phase of a court battle in which it has accused the online search leader of breaking antitrust law with its tactics.
articles.title: US wraps up antitrust case against Google in historic trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Meta Platforms (META.O) on Thursday launched two new AI-based features for video editing that could be used for posting to Instagram or Facebook.
articles.title: Meta launches AI-based video editing tools

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The union for Canadian miner First Quantum's unit in Panama said on Thursday that it reached an agreement with the company to guarantee salaries as protests and blockades against the miner prevent them from working.
articles.title: First Quantum's Panama unit, union reach deal on salaries amid mine blockades

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israeli soldiers found a tunnel shaft used by Hamas militants at Gaza's Al Shifa hospital, the army said, while the U.N. voiced concern no aid would be delivered to Palestinians on Friday via the Rafah crossing with Egypt.
articles.title: Hamas tunnel found at Gaza's Al Shifa hospital, says Israel; UN aid halted

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Thursday said he would keep working to advance a Pacific trade pact, even as his vision for a regional deal to counter China's influence stumbled over his bid to strengthen workers' rights.
articles.title: At APEC, Biden touts workers' rights, stable Chinese relations

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: The federal civil rights trial of a former Louisville, Kentucky, police officer charged in the 2020 death of Breonna Taylor, a Black woman whose killing fueled a wave of racial justice protests, was declared a mistrial on Thursday.
articles.title: Mistrial declared for Kentucky officer charged in Breonna Taylor killing
